thread.title: BRIT Awards 2017: Little Mix’s Jade suffers wardrobe malfunction as she flashes EVERYTHING
thread.title_full: BRIT Awards 2017: Little Mix’s Jade suffers wardrobe malfunction as she flashes EVERYTHING

title: BRIT Awards 2017: Little Mix’s Jade suffers wardrobe malfunction as she flashes EVERYTHING
text:
PA BRIT Awards: Jade could be seen holding down her dress 
While Jade initially seemed unfazed by the embarrassing incident, she quickly tried to rectify the situation as she grasped at her gown. 
She could be seen holding her skirt down as she made her way into the bash while she also placed her left hand over her chest to ensure her best assets didn’t make an appearance too. 
The brunette beauty teamed her nineties-inspired gown with a pair of over-the-elbow black leather gloves and strappy sandals. 
Meanwhile, fellow bandmate Perrie Edwards flaunted her endless pins as she opted for a feathered asymmetric gown. GETTY BRIT Awards: The Little Mix girls showcased a variety of quirky designs at the ceremony 
Her fluffy frock featured a PVC bustier-style top, which ensured her ample cleavage was on full display. 
She added height to her look with a pair of black sandals, while she styled her blonde locks in a quirky braided ‘do. 
Leigh-Anne Pinnock found herself on the worst-dressed list after she chose a distressed denim gown. Her strapless number featured a ripped hem and plaited detailing down the side. 
And, completing the group, was Jesy Nelson who sported a floor-length leather gown which had a racy split up the front of her skirt. 
She put on a very busty display in the low-cut number, while her brunette locks were left in cascading curls. GETTY BRIT Awards: Ellie Goulding flaunted major sideboob as she joined the girls on the red carpet 
They were joined on the red carpet by Ellie Goulding who flaunted major sideboob as she went braless in a racy black dress. 
Her generous décolletage took centre-stage as the Burn hitmaker risked a nip slip due to the precarious chain straps holding her frock in place. 
The 30-year-old is nominated for the British Female Solo Artist BRIT award and will face competition from Anohni, Emeli Sande, Lianne La Havas and Nao. 
The BRIT Awards air on ITV tonight at 7.30pm. Related articles
